text: The 1963 Philadelphia Phillies season was the 81st in franchise history. The 87–75 Phillies finished the season in fourth place in the National League, 12 games behind the NL and World Champion Los Angeles Dodgers. == Offseason == * November 21, 1962: Jimmie Coker purchased from the Phillies by the Baltimore Orioles.Jimmie Coker at Baseball Reference * November 26, 1962: Bob Lipski was drafted from the Phillies by the Cleveland Indians in the 1962 rule 5 draft.Bob Lipski at Baseball Reference * December 11, 1962: Jacke Davis was traded by the Phillies to the Los Angeles Angels for Earl Averill, Jr..Earl Averill, Jr. at Baseball Reference == Regular season == * May 17, 1963, Don Nottebart pitched the first no-hitter for an expansion team when the Houston Colt .45s defeated Philadelphia by a score of 4–1.Great Baseball Feats, Facts and Figures, 2008 Edition, p. 143, David Nemec and Scott Flatow, A Signet Book, Penguin Group, New York, === Season standings === === Record vs. opponents === === Notable transactions === * June 12, 1963: Darrell Sutherland was signed as an amateur free agent by the Phillies.Darrell Sutherland at Baseball Reference * August 24, 1963: Dwight Siebler was purchased from the Phillies by the Minnesota Twins.Dwight
